pr_title: DDF-5900 removed the use of security-core-impl from all non-security bundles

timeline.message: DDF-5900 removed the use of security-core-impl from all non-security bundles
DDF-5900 removed the use of security-core-impl from all non-security bundles
DDF-5900 removed the use of security-core-impl from all non-security bundles

timeline.bodyText: ❓ Why remove the annotation? Is the response no longer nullable?
timeline.author: SmithJosh

replies.bodyText: Because it was forcing a dependency on guava for an unnecessary annotation.
replies.author: stustison

timeline.bodyText:
✏️ These builder methods might be better as static methods on the interface.
Pro: when you want to call one of these builders, you don't have to inject a Permissions service into the java class. You just call the static interface method.
Con: testing
timeline.author: bakejeyner

replies.bodyText: Can't do a static method without embedding the bundle or directly referencing an impl of some sort via an import.
replies.author: stustison
